sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Welcome to Unit 61 of our English learning journey. In this unit, we'll explore the use of verb-preposition combinations followed by -ing forms.

sections.title: Definition
sections.content: This structure adds depth and specificity to your language use. Let's delve into the key concepts.

sections.title: Format-1
points: Explore how certain verbs are followed by specific prepositions when used with -ing forms.
She succeeded in passing the exam
He insisted on finishing the project

sections.title: Format-2
points: Examine common verb-preposition combinations and understand their meanings.
Look forward to,' 'depend on,' 'apologize for,' etc.

sections.title: Examples
sections.content: Let's examine examples to illustrate the application of 'Verb + Preposition + -ing'

examples.Positive: She is good at succeeding in challenging situations
examples.Negative: They apologized for interrupting the meeting
examples.Interrogative: He insisted on being involved in the decision-making process

sections.title: Usage and Context
sections.content: Understand the appropriate contexts for using verb-preposition combinations with -ing forms and how they enhance communication.

sections.title: Recap and Summary:
sections.content: In summary, using verb-preposition combinations with -ing forms adds precision to your language. Pay attention to the specific combinations and their meanings.

sections.title: Additional Resources:
sections.content: For additional practice and reinforcement, consider exploring examples in language learning books and online exercises.

sections.title: Conclusion
sections.content: Thank you for joining today's lesson on 'Verb + Preposition + -ing.' Practice using these combinations confidently in various situations, and feel free to reach out if you have any questions. Happy learning!
